metadata.name: Azure Stack HCI Cluster
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Stack HCI Cluster on the provided Arc Machines.
Required. The names of the network adapters to include in the intent.
Required. The name of the network intent.
Required. Specify whether to override the adapter property. Use false by default.
Required. The jumboPacket configuration for the network adapters.
Required. The networkDirect configuration for the network adapters.
Required. The networkDirectTechnology configuration for the network adapters.
Required. The adapter property overrides for the network intent.
Required. Specify whether to override the qosPolicy property. Use false by default.
Required. The bandwidthPercentage for the network intent. Recommend 50.
Required. Recommend 7.
Required. Recommend 3.
Required. The qosPolicy overrides for the network intent.
Required. Specify whether to override the virtualSwitchConfiguration property. Use false by default.
Required. The enableIov configuration for the network intent.
Required. The loadBalancingAlgorithm configuration for the network intent.
Required. The virtualSwitchConfiguration overrides for the network intent.
Required. The traffic types for the network intent.
Required. The HCI node name.
Required. The IPv4 address for the storage adapter.
Required. The subnet mask for the storage adapter.
Required. The name of the storage adapter.
Required. The VLAN for the storage adapter.
Optional. The storage adapter IP information for 3-node switchless or manual config deployments.
Required. Enable/Disable HVCI protection.
Required. Enable/Disable DRTM protection.
Required. Enable/Disable Drift Control enforcement.
Required. Enable/Disable Credential Guard enforcement.
Required. Enable/Disable SMB signing enforcement.
Required. Enable/Disable SMB cluster encryption.
Required. Enable/Disable Side Channel Mitigation enforcement.
Required. Enable/Disable BitLocker protection for boot volume.
Required. Enable/Disable BitLocker protection for data volumes.
Required. Enable/Disable WDAC enforcement.

Required. The prefix for the resource for the deployment. This value is used in key vault and storage account names in this template, as well as for the deploymentSettings.properties.deploymentConfiguration.scaleUnits.deploymentData.namingPrefix property which requires regex pattern: ^[a-zA-Z0-9-]{1,8}$.
Required. Names of the cluster node Arc Machine resources. These are the name of the Arc Machine resources created when the new HCI nodes were Arc initialized. Example: [hci-node-1, hci-node-2].
Required. The domain name of the Active Directory Domain Services. Example: "contoso.com".
Required. The ADDS OU path - ex "OU=HCI,DC=contoso,DC=com".
Optional. The Hypervisor-protected Code Integrity setting.
Optional. The hardware-dependent Secure Boot setting.
Optional. When set to true, the security baseline is re-applied regularly.
Optional. Enables the Credential Guard.
Optional. When set to true, the SMB default instance requires sign in for the client and server services.
Optional. When set to true, cluster east-west traffic is encrypted.
Optional. When set to true, all the side channel mitigations are enabled.
Optional. When set to true, BitLocker XTS_AES 256-bit encryption is enabled for all data-at-rest on the OS volume of your Azure Stack HCI cluster. This setting is TPM-hardware dependent.
Optional. When set to true, BitLocker XTS-AES 256-bit encryption is enabled for all data-at-rest on your Azure Stack HCI cluster shared volumes.
Optional. Limits the applications and the code that you can run on your Azure Stack HCI cluster.
Optional. The metrics data for deploying a HCI cluster.
Optional. The location data for deploying a HCI cluster.
Optional. The diagnostic data for deploying a HCI cluster.
Optional. The storage volume configuration mode. See documentation for details.
Required. The subnet mask pf the Management Network for the HCI cluster - ex: 255.255.252.0.
Required. The default gateway of the Management Network. Example: 192.168.0.1.
Required. The starting IP address for the Infrastructure Network IP pool. There must be at least 6 IPs between startingIPAddress and endingIPAddress and this pool should be not include the node IPs.
Required. The ending IP address for the Infrastructure Network IP pool. There must be at least 6 IPs between startingIPAddress and endingIPAddress and this pool should be not include the node IPs.
Required. The DNS servers accessible from the Management Network for the HCI cluster.
Required. An array of Network ATC Network Intent objects that define the Compute, Management, and Storage network configuration for the cluster.
Required. Specify whether the Storage Network connectivity is switched or switchless.

Optional. Enable storage auto IP assignment. This should be true for most deployments except when deploying a three-node switchless cluster, in which case storage IPs should be configured before deployment and this value set to false.
Required. An array of JSON objects that define the storage network configuration for the cluster. Each object should contain the adapterName, VLAN properties, and (optionally) IP configurations.

Required. The name of the Custom Location associated with the Arc Resource Bridge for this cluster. This value should reflect the physical location and identifier of the HCI cluster. Example: cl-hci-den-clu01.
Required. The name of the storage account to be used as the witness for the HCI Windows Failover Cluster.
Required. The name of the key vault to be used for storing secrets for the HCI cluster. This currently needs to be unique per HCI cluster.
Optional. If using a shared key vault or non-legacy secret naming, pass the properties.cloudId guid from the pre-created HCI cluster resource.
Required. The name of the Azure Stack HCI LCM user credential secret.
Required. The name of the Azure Stack HCI local admin credential secret.
Required. The name of the Azure Stack HCI default ARB application secret.
Required. The name of the Azure Stack HCI witness storage key secret.
Key vault secret names interface
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The name of the Azure Stack HCI cluster - this must be a valid Active Directory computer name and will be the name of your cluster in Azure.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The cluster deployment operations to execute. Defaults to "[Validate, Deploy]".
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The deployment settings of the cluster.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Specify whether to use the shared key vault for the HCI cluster.
Optional. The type of the witness.
Conditional. The name of the deployment user. Required if useSharedKeyVault is false.
Conditional. The password of the deployment user. Required if useSharedKeyVault is false.
Conditional. The name of the local admin user. Required if useSharedKeyVault is false.
Conditional. The password of the local admin user. Required if useSharedKeyVault is false.
Optional. The service principal ID for ARB.
Optional. The service principal secret for ARB.
Optional. Content type of the azure stack lcm user credential.
Optional. Content type of the local admin credential.
Optional. Content type of the witness storage key.
Optional. Content type of the default ARB application.
Optional. Key vault secret names mapping.
Optional. Tags of azure stack LCM user credential.
Optional. Tags of the local admin credential.
Optional. Tags of the witness storage key.
Optional. Tags of the default ARB application.

metadata.name: Key Vaults
metadata.description: This module deploys a Key Vault.
The name of the private endpoint.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The group Id for the private endpoint Group.
FQDN that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
The custom DNS configurations of the private endpoint.
The IDs of the network interfaces associated with the private endpoint.
The item's resourceId.
The item's uri.
The item's uri with version.
The type for a credential output.
Optional. The tenant ID that is used for authenticating requests to the key vault.
Required. The object ID of a user, service principal or security group in the tenant for the vault.
Optional. Application ID of the client making request on behalf of a principal.
Optional. Permissions to keys.
Optional. Permissions to secrets.
Optional. Permissions to certificates.
Optional. Permissions to storage accounts.
Required. Permissions the identity has for keys, secrets and certificates.
The type for an access policy.
Required. The name of the secret.
Optional. Resource tags.
Optional. Defines whether the secret is enabled or disabled.
Optional. Defines when the secret will become invalid. Defined in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.
Optional. If set, defines the date from which onwards the secret becomes valid. Defined in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.
Optional. Contains attributes of the secret.
Optional. The content type of the secret.

Required. The value of the secret. NOTE: "value" will never be returned from the service, as APIs using this model are is intended for internal use in ARM deployments. Users should use the data-plane REST service for interaction with vault secrets.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The type for a secret output.
Required. The name of the key.
Optional. Resource tags.
Optional. Defines whether the key is enabled or disabled.
Optional. Defines when the key will become invalid. Defined in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.
Optional. If set, defines the date from which onwards the key becomes valid. Defined in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.
Optional. Contains attributes of the key.
Optional. The elliptic curve name. Only works if "keySize" equals "EC" or "EC-HSM". Default is "P-256".
Optional. The allowed operations on this key.
Optional. The key size in bits. Only works if "keySize" equals "RSA" or "RSA-HSM". Default is "4096".
Optional. The type of the key. Default is "EC".
Optional. Content type and version of key release policy.
Optional. Blob encoding the policy rules under which the key can be released.
Optional. Key release policy.
Optional. Key rotation policy.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The type for a key.
Optional. The expiration time for the new key version. It should be in ISO8601 format. Eg: "P90D", "P1Y".
Optional. The attributes of key rotation policy.
Optional. The type of action.
Optional. The action of key rotation policy lifetimeAction.
Optional. The time duration after key creation to rotate the key. It only applies to rotate. It will be in ISO 8601 duration format. Eg: "P90D", "P1Y".
Optional. The time duration before key expiring to rotate or notify. It will be in ISO 8601 duration format. Eg: "P90D", "P1Y".
Optional. The trigger of key rotation policy lifetimeAction.
Optional. The lifetimeActions for key rotation action.
The type for a rotation policy.
Optional. FQDN that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS Zone Group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. The private DNS Zone Groups to associate the Private Endpoint. A DNS Zone Group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. The name of the Private Endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the Private Endpoint to.
Optional. The name of the private link connection to create.
Optional. The subresource to deploy the Private Endpoint for. For example "vault" for a Key Vault Private Endpoint.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The resource ID of the Resource Group the Private Endpoint will be created in. If not specified, the Resource Group of the provided Virtual Network Subnet is used.
Optional. The private DNS Zone Group to configure for the Private Endpoint.
Optional. If Manual Private Link Connection is required.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with the manual connection request.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the Private Endpoint. This will be used to map to the first-party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the Private Endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the Private Endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/Resource Groups in this deployment.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

An AVM-aligned type for a private endpoint. To be used if the private endpoint's default service / groupId can be assumed (i.e., for services that only have one Private Endpoint type like 'vault' for key vault).
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. Name of the Key Vault. Must be globally unique.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. All access policies to create.
Optional. All secrets to create.
Optional. All keys to create.
Optional. Specifies if the vault is enabled for deployment by script or compute.
Optional. Specifies if the vault is enabled for a template deployment.
Optional. Specifies if the azure platform has access to the vault for enabling disk encryption scenarios.
Optional. Switch to enable/disable Key Vault's soft delete feature.
Optional. softDelete data retention days. It accepts >=7 and <=90.

Optional. Property that controls how data actions are authorized. When true, the key vault will use Role Based Access Control (RBAC) for authorization of data actions, and the access policies specified in vault properties will be ignored. When false, the key vault will use the access policies specified in vault properties, and any policy stored on Azure Resource Manager will be ignored. Note that management actions are always authorized with RBAC.
Optional. The vault's create mode to indicate whether the vault need to be recovered or not. - recover or default.
Optional. Provide 'true' to enable Key Vault's purge protection feature.
Optional. Specifies the SKU for the vault.
Optional. Rules governing the accessibility of the resource from specific network locations.

Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set and networkAcls are not set.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. Resource tags.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.networkAcls: [if(not(empty(coalesce(parameters('networkAcls'), createObject()))), createObject('bypass', tryGet(parameters('networkAcls'), 'bypass'), 'defaultAction', tryGet(parameters('networkAcls'), 'defaultAction'), 'virtualNetworkRules', coalesce(tryGet(parameters('networkAcls'), 'virtualNetworkRules'), createArray()), 'ipRules', coalesce(tryGet(parameters('networkAcls'), 'ipRules'), createArray())), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Key Vault Access Policies
metadata.description: This module deploys a Key Vault Access Policy.
Optional. The tenant ID that is used for authenticating requests to the key vault.
Required. The object ID of a user, service principal or security group in the tenant for the vault.
Optional. Application ID of the client making request on behalf of a principal.
Optional. Permissions to keys.
Optional. Permissions to secrets.
Optional. Permissions to certificates.
Optional. Permissions to storage accounts.
Required. Permissions the identity has for keys, secrets and certificates.
The type for an access policy.
Conditional. The name of the parent key vault. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. An array of 0 to 16 identities that have access to the key vault. All identities in the array must use the same tenant ID as the key vault's tenant ID.
The name of the resource group the access policies assignment was created in.
The name of the access policies assignment.
The resource ID of the access policies assignment.

metadata.name: Key Vault Secrets
metadata.description: This module deploys a Key Vault Secret.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Conditional. The name of the parent key vault. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the secret.
Optional. Resource tags.
Optional. Determines whether the object is enabled.
Optional. Expiry date in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z. For security reasons, it is recommended to set an expiration date whenever possible.
Optional. Not before date in seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.
Optional. The content type of the secret.

Required. The value of the secret. NOTE: "value" will never be returned from the service, as APIs using this model are is intended for internal use in ARM deployments. Users should use the data-plane REST service for interaction with vault secrets.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The name of the secret.
The resource ID of the secret.
The uri of the secret.
The uri with version of the secret.
The name of the resource group the secret was created in.

parameters.curveName: [if(and(not(equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('keys'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'kty'), 'RSA')), not(equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('keys'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'kty'), 'RSA-HSM'))), createObject('value', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('keys'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'curveName'), 'P-256')), createObject('value', null()))]
parameters.keySize: [if(or(equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('keys'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'kty'), 'RSA'), equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('keys'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'kty'), 'RSA-HSM')), createObject('value', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('keys'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'keySize'), 4096)), createObject('value', null()))]

metadata.name: Key Vault Keys

Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.

metadata.name: Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone configurations of the private DNS zone group. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The custom DNS configurations of the private endpoint.
The resource IDs of the network interfaces associated with the private endpoint.
The group Id for the private endpoint Group.
The resource ID of the key vault.
The name of the resource group the key vault was created in.
The name of the key vault.
The URI of the key vault.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The private endpoints of the key vault.
The properties of the created secrets.
The properties of the created keys.

metadata.name: Azure Stack HCI Cluster Deployment Settings
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Stack HCI Cluster Deployment Settings resource.
Optional. The name of the deployment settings.

Conditional. The name of the Azure Stack HCI cluster - this must be a valid Active Directory computer name and will be the name of your cluster in Azure. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.

Required. First must pass with this parameter set to Validate prior running with it set to Deploy. If either Validation or Deployment phases fail, fix the issue, then resubmit the template with the same deploymentMode to retry.

Required. The prefix for the resource for the deployment. This value is used in key vault and storage account names in this template, as well as for the deploymentSettings.properties.deploymentConfiguration.scaleUnits.deploymentData.namingPrefix property which requires regex pattern: ^[a-zA-Z0-9-]{1,8}$.
Required. Names of the cluster node Arc Machine resources. These are the name of the Arc Machine resources created when the new HCI nodes were Arc initialized. Example: [hci-node-1, hci-node-2].
Required. The domain name of the Active Directory Domain Services. Example: "contoso.com".
Required. The ADDS OU path - ex "OU=HCI,DC=contoso,DC=com".
Optional. The Hypervisor-protected Code Integrity setting.
Optional. The hardware-dependent Secure Boot setting.
Optional. When set to true, the security baseline is re-applied regularly.
Optional. Enables the Credential Guard.
Optional. When set to true, the SMB default instance requires sign in for the client and server services.
Optional. When set to true, cluster east-west traffic is encrypted.
Optional. When set to true, all the side channel mitigations are enabled.
Optional. When set to true, BitLocker XTS_AES 256-bit encryption is enabled for all data-at-rest on the OS volume of your Azure Stack HCI cluster. This setting is TPM-hardware dependent.
Optional. When set to true, BitLocker XTS-AES 256-bit encryption is enabled for all data-at-rest on your Azure Stack HCI cluster shared volumes.
Optional. Limits the applications and the code that you can run on your Azure Stack HCI cluster.
Optional. The metrics data for deploying a HCI cluster.
Optional. The location data for deploying a HCI cluster.
Optional. The diagnostic data for deploying a HCI cluster.
Optional. The storage volume configuration mode. See documentation for details.
Required. The subnet mask pf the Management Network for the HCI cluster - ex: 255.255.252.0.
Required. The default gateway of the Management Network. Example: 192.168.0.1.
Required. The starting IP address for the Infrastructure Network IP pool. There must be at least 6 IPs between startingIPAddress and endingIPAddress and this pool should be not include the node IPs.
Required. The ending IP address for the Infrastructure Network IP pool. There must be at least 6 IPs between startingIPAddress and endingIPAddress and this pool should be not include the node IPs.
Required. The DNS servers accessible from the Management Network for the HCI cluster.
Required. An array of Network ATC Network Intent objects that define the Compute, Management, and Storage network configuration for the cluster.
Required. Specify whether the Storage Network connectivity is switched or switchless.

Optional. Enable storage auto IP assignment. This should be true for most deployments except when deploying a three-node switchless cluster, in which case storage IPs should be configured before deployment and this value set to false.
Required. An array of JSON objects that define the storage network configuration for the cluster. Each object should contain the adapterName, VLAN properties, and (optionally) IP configurations.

Required. The name of the Custom Location associated with the Arc Resource Bridge for this cluster. This value should reflect the physical location and identifier of the HCI cluster. Example: cl-hci-den-clu01.
Required. The name of the storage account to be used as the witness for the HCI Windows Failover Cluster.
Required. The name of the key vault to be used for storing secrets for the HCI cluster. This currently needs to be unique per HCI cluster.
Optional. If using a shared key vault or non-legacy secret naming, pass the properties.cloudId guid from the pre-created HCI cluster resource.

input.secretLocation: [if(empty(parameters('cloudId')), format('https://{0}{1}/secrets/{2}', parameters('keyVaultName'), environment().suffixes.keyvaultDns, createArray('LocalAdminCredential', 'AzureStackLCMUserCredential', 'DefaultARBApplication', 'WitnessStorageKey')[copyIndex('secrets')]), format('https://{0}{1}/secrets/{2}-{3}-{4}', parameters('keyVaultName'), environment().suffixes.keyvaultDns, parameters('clusterName'), createArray('LocalAdminCredential', 'AzureStackLCMUserCredential', 'DefaultARBApplication', 'WitnessStorageKey')[copyIndex('secrets')], parameters('cloudId')))]

metadata.description: The name of the cluster deployment settings.
The ID of the cluster deployment settings.
The resource group of the cluster deployment settings.
The name of the cluster.
The ID of the cluster.
The resource group of the cluster.
The managed identity of the cluster.
The location of the cluster.
